p:
Climate variability shapes physiological traits, spatial distribution and interactions among species, defining the phenology (i.e., seasonal timing of cyclical biological events such as reproduction), the trophodynamics and ultimately the pace of matter and energy transfer in food webs
1 . Species have evolved complex behavioural and life history strategies to maximize fitness, e.g. exploiting the periods of the year best matching optimal niche requirements for growth, survival and reproduction
2, 3 . Thus, at long time-scales evolution shapes the distribution and the phenology of predators and prey
4, 5 . Species below the top predator level engage in a co-evolutionary game
6 consisting in seasonally matching their prey while “mismatching” their predators
7 .
